entries.a942608fc41e: Single-page localization playground with build-time and runtime i18n demos.
entries.ac009679e312: Show this in order: locale switch, static compilation, runtime translation, formatting, RTL direction, then CI coverage.
entries.46c6b7b0aeb2: 1. Change the navbar language and show full-page locale switch.
entries.d7c740bd42a6: 2. Static UI section proves build-time extracted strings.
entries.37f5d452f8e0: 3. Runtime section translates user text with from/to locales.
entries.2b79c08aeaab: 4. Formatting section shows locale-aware currency and date output.
entries.be30a9462893: 5. Layout Direction section proves RTL switching for Arabic.
entries.881c6e37ad42: 6. Workflow page shows CLI + CI coverage gate before deploy.
entries.258e66e9a3e1: These strings are compiled for localization at build time through Lingo Compiler.
entries.77516117dffc: Track locale coverage across product surfaces.
entries.69188da02d56: Queue string updates before release cut.
entries.681cefb8c1fd: Review formatting and layout in each locale.
entries.8caf11d83fc7: This calls <code0></code0>, powered by the Lingo SDK, for dynamic user text.
entries.99481fc827b1: Values below are generated with <code0></code0> and <code1></code1>.
entries.f0f841d21fc2: A single-page playground for build-time localization, runtime translation, RTL behavior, locale formatting, and developer workflow automation.
entries.038e40f75d70: Lingo Compiler extracts static UI strings during build and serves locale specific output when you change language.
entries.e62b09fca9f1: Switch language in the header to verify this section updates instantly.
entries.1f556bc7feb7: Runtime translation handles dynamic text through the SDK-backed <code0></code0> route.
entries.d90edd531376: When locale is Arabic, the document direction switches to <code0></code0> and layout follows right-to-left flow.
entries.81994147d76f: Currency and date formatting react to current locale via <code0></code0> and <code1></code1>.
entries.e7f6a394e162: Automation keeps localization up to date: run CLI in development and enforce translation coverage in CI before deployment.
entries.db3098f41e71: LangOS: localization architecture, playground, and developer philosophy.
entries.56af6bc1a25f: A real-world localization lab powered by Lingo.dev.
entries.fc3cb23fde0b: Localization checks passed for this branch.
entries.eabc014a6b52: Localization failures are rarely translation failures. They are architecture failures. LangOS is designed to make these failure modes explicit and preventable.
entries.cda1acfee5bb: The target panel can flip direction without moving source text.
entries.4903706b6c08: Left column stays English as the source of truth. Right column renders the selected locale for side-by-side comparison.
entries.8b19c1422732: Static UI strings are extracted at build time and served in the target locale.
entries.ea3f41f153b6: <strong0>How it works:</strong0> Lingo Compiler rewrites static copy to keyed lookups, and the target provider resolves those keys for the selected locale.
entries.a92d478ecbb1: Dynamic text is translated on demand through the SDK-backed API route.
entries.789dde11e992: Type text that did not exist at build time
entries.73d5db78b328: Source locale is fixed to English.
entries.ca56ca679d9b: <strong0>How it works:</strong0> The client posts source text to <code0></code0>, which calls Lingo SDK and returns locale-specific output.
entries.2892c7a57b80: Arabic applies right-to-left direction only inside the target preview.
entries.4160013a8b75: <strong0>How it works:</strong0> Direction is derived from the selected target locale, and applied to the right demo container only so the source column stays stable.
entries.19fdcbfaa7ad: Formatting updates through <code0></code0> based on locale conventions.
entries.3794b6dff3b4: <strong0>How it works:</strong0> Locale-specific formatters apply proper grouping, symbols, and date ordering with no string templates.
entries.03b524f433db: Localization checks run in development and are enforced in CI before shipping.
entries.d3e562497d5d: <strong0>How it works:</strong0> CLI refreshes translation artifacts locally, and CI blocks merges when localized output is missing.
entries.41f6c8e2cd26: A real-world localization lab for production-grade i18n workflows.
